column4: hi. i need some help setting up DMA data transfer-- does anyone know stuff about DMA?
which drive are you trying to enable it on?

i was playing a dvd and it was choppy so i checked out the wiki on dvd's and it sent me to the DMA page and i tried to follow those directions but it didn't work. so i guess the short answer would be that i am trying to enable my cd/dvd drive. (?)
what kind of error did you get?
what kind of video card do you have/
well it did something... so that must be closer, but it said: HDIO_GETGEO failed: Invalid argument
what was the exact command you ran/
i have a nvidia geforce4 (i not sure if the spelling of that is right but that is the sentiment of it)
the command line was: bradley@homey:~$ sudo hdparm /dev/dvd
sorry I think I meant to direct that question to someone else, about the video card
and it just outputted that error?
yeah and you can edit /etc/hdparm.conf to make sure that gets set at boot
do you think that was right? do i have to do the same thing for cd's?

before i save any changes to hdparm.conf i have two questions: 1. everything line before it begins with #, should i add that at the beginning of the lines that i add too? 2. if /dev/dvd worked to set DMA in the terminal i would use that in hdparm.conf instead of the dev/hdc right?
